The general problem we faced in this round was two things. Firstly, was that the adj did not credit or track some of the content that we brought out in p1. The adj said that p1 shot themselves in their foot from the frame that the people who engage in situationships do it out of convenience, but in p1 we believe we made the distinction very clear. That even if 50% of people join these situationships on the premise that its not serious, that there is likely to be a significant proportion of people who join it with very optimistic perceptions that this will go well. We believed in gov that we mechanized the claims for this pretty well down the bench, the proof for which can be provided if needed. We believe the adj not taking this claim down led to them discrediting a significant majority of our claims, as this framing was crucial for our first path to victory. Again, we understand that adjng may be a very subjective endeavor, but we are quite disheartened by the fact that the ignorance of this framing led to us losing this debate as we did the best on gov to make this very clear. Secondly, is we also felt that the adj intervened in places where it was not ideal to do so. In our debate, opp ran the claim that people would take these relationships simultaneously serious and at the same time find it very easy to do so. The distinction here is that we felt that opp did not point out this contradiction adequately and even if they made the distinction, we felt in p3 we made the response that the perception of these relationships is still likely to be unequal, meaning that people would still struggle. The third reason we disagreed with the OA was that we felt that the adj heavily undermined a significant amount of govs claims in this debate, especially claims that went unresponded from opp bench. We ran 2 independent claims that proved why you are likely to have increased support structures from family and that young people, whom we framed as most vulnerable are significantly better off. Even if these claims werent mechanized significantly (which we thought was quite adequate) was still weighed against all other claims by prop in this debate, to which the adj we felt didnt credit much, even after us pointing out the significance of these arguments. Perhaps in the attempt to clash out the debate the adj may have lost track of some of the content that came out in which gov was independently winning on. We of course realize that adjudicating debates is a very hard thing to do, and there may be mishaps and perhaps that even we may be wrong in this comment, but we thought we had to be honest with this comment to ensure that this tournament runs at the best capacity it could.

tournament.motion: TH as "Jelly Cup" would do an identity reveal Kamala Harischandra is a famous internet personality who goes by the name "Jelly Cup". "Jelly Cup" has fans all around the globe, but her real identity is completely hidden. Kamala takes great measures to conceal her voice, appearance, gender, nationality, etc. and has spent large part of her life building up the persona. Kamala also knows that many of her friends, aquaintances and neighbours are die-hard fans of "Jelly Cup"

THO the rise of the situationships A "situationship" is a term used to describe a romantic or intimate relationship that lacks clear definitions or commitment. Situationships are characterized by emotional intimacy, spending time together, and often involve a sexual component. However, people in a situationship do not set clear boundaries for their relationship or place it in a category

THBT enlightened despotism is superior to democracy Enlightened despotism refers to a form of absolute rule where a monarch or leader governs with the principles of Enlightenment, such as reason, tolerance, and reform
TH as a feminist living in Asia supports this theory Feminist conflict theory suggest that gender is best understood as men attempting to maintain power and privilege to the detriment of women

This house prefers the open qualifier system over the franchising system in eSports.

Franchising: a set number of teams sign contracts with a tournament organizer, receive royalties from merchandise sales rather than prize money, no eliminations from the league, franchises are divided into set regional cleavages (e.g. 12 North American spots, 8 Asian spots, etc.) 

Open: tournament organizer hosts open qualifiers in which any team can participate. The strongest teams will continue to guarantee spots in future tournaments via "breaking" to playoffs, etc., while teams which have been routinely losing are dropped out of the league for new up-and-coming rosters that inevitably qualify over them in relegation matches.

This house, as Shinji, would reject Instrumentality You are Shinji, the son of the leader of a secretive governmental organization known as NERV. NERV's parent organization has recently completed the Human Instumentality Project, which it believes is the next step in humanity's evolution.
The Human Instrumentality Project has united the consciousnesses of all of humanity into a single, transcendental being without a physical body that exists outside the material world. Every human being that is part of the Instrumentality Project remains conscious and continues to experience existence, but is part of a greater whole in which they share the memories and experiences of every other human being alive. In Instrumentality, one can no longer experience physical pain or suffering.
You possess the capability to reject Instrumentality. If you do, you will return to the physical world as a human being. You know that other human beings also can choose to reject Instrumentality, but you do not know if any will do so.
